titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Jean Scobie Davis (1892-1985) graduated from Bryn Mawr College in 1914. She received her master's degree in 1921 from the University of Wisconsin. That summer she was a tutor in Economics at the first session of the Bryn Mawr Summer School for Women Workers in Industry. Over the course of her long career she taught at several colleges including Agnes Scott College, Vassar, Pierce, Wells, and the American Women's College in Beirut. She retired in 1957. Davis had a lifelong interest in prison reform, and was a member of the Board of Visitors of the New York State Correctional Facility in Bedford Hills, New York, for 36 years.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: A paper finding aid is available in the repository.
